header_summary: Programmer proposes bLIP for implementing Taproot Asset Protocol within BOLT channel format, enabling holding and transferring of assets. RFQ negotiation scheme allows multi-hop payments using Taproot Assets. Invoices denominated in BTC remain unchanged, providing flexibility for asset conversion. Future plans include expanding RFQ system. Feedback sought for protocol enhancement. Release of tapd v0.3 and lnd v0.17 imminent, allowing asset transactions on Lightning Network edges.

recent_posts.title: New BIP to align descriptors, xpub derivation and miniscript
recent_posts.summary:
- Some wallets supporting descriptors maintain vague BIP44 compatibility without specific output types.
- BIP44 compatibility is kept in certain wallets for non-descriptor wallet compatibility and xpub extraction.
- Reusing public keys within a Miniscript is possible by deriving different hardened xpubs or using a single xpub with unhardened derivation steps.

recent_posts.title: Actuarial System To Reduce Interactivity In N-of-N (N > 2) Multiparticipant Offchain Mechanisms
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses participant non-interactivity in Zeeman 40 and its effects on R reveals.
- The concern is that the new off-chain state, N1', poses a security risk to the actuary bond.
- It is suggested that R reveals should only occur after all group participants reveal their signatures.

recent_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
recent_posts.summary:
- The sender questions the straightforwardness of classifying users as "casual" or "dedicated".
- Different scaling notions are suggested to measure the performance of off-chain constructions.
- Concerns are raised about group coordination, routing, and fault-tolerance in off-chain constructions.

recent_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine raises concerns about the classification of users and the design of protocols.
- He questions the focus on onboarding scalability and presents alternative scaling notions.
- Antoine points out difficulties with group coordination, routing, and fault-tolerance in the proposal.

recent_posts.title: CLBOSS v0.13 aka "Born to Run" Release
recent_posts.summary:
- CLBOSS is now compliant with modern CLN versions, thanks to Ken for reviving the project.
- The release of CLBOSS marks an important milestone in its development.
- For more information about CLBOSS and its features, click on the provided link.

recent_posts.title: blip-0029: Taproot Asset Protocol Channels
recent_posts.summary:
- A bLIP has been published describing how to map the Taproot Asset Protocol onto the BOLT channel/invoice format.
- An RFQ last-mile negotiation scheme is used for multi-hop payments using Taproot Assets edge liquidity.
- The release of tapd v0.3 and lnd v0.17 will enable sending and receiving assets on the Lightning Network.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The implementation of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains is in progress.
- The server will be 'blinded' and won't have access to certain information.
- The protocol involves key aggregation, nonce aggregation, and message signing.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- Storage for blockchain is sufficient due to factors like maximum block size and block time.
- A 5TB hard drive costing less than $150 can provide storage for 21 years.
- Ongoing optimization efforts and affordable hardware ensure sufficient storage for blockchain.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT.
- The code is implemented in the bitcoin-inquisition repo fork, including OP_CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY.
- The changes include replacing OP_CHECK{IN, OUT}CONTRACTVERIFY with OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY and modifying the order of parameters.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new way to make lightning channels resumable from a wallet seed.
- It addresses issues with channel backups and provides a solution for fraud proofs.
- The proposal also suggests ways to save bandwidth and discusses alternative options.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard, a Lightning Network (LN) developer, proposes organizing the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024.
- The summit aims to leverage Africa's cultural diversity, fragmented financial systems, and local Lightning developers.
- Antoine seeks objections and feedback, emphasizing transparency and plans to survey suitable host countries.

active_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
active_posts.summary:
- Bastien has submitted a pull request to document the idea of securely sending commands to a lightning node from an untrusted machine using an HSM.
- This architecture requires minimal changes to the lightning node and can be implemented on a Ledger Nano S.
- Bastien suggests that this concept could be done under an open-source grant and volunteers to contribute and review the implementation.
